column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

There was a larger yarding of 222 trade and export cattle (60 more) at Powranna on Tuesday with over half being cows.
With extra restocker competition yearlings improved 10c to 30c with steers making 210c to 246c and heifers 180c to 252c/kg.
With extra competition, grown steers improved 30c making 252c to 274c/kg.

There were approximately 120 cows and with extra interstate competition combined with strong local interest heavy cows averaged 17c dearer making 158c to 194c, leaner 110c to 140c and very lean D1 cows 72c to 110c.

Heavy bulls made 140c to 150c/kg live weight.

Market Reporter Richard Bailey
